item.title: Kathy add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "You can never get a cup of tea large enough or a book long enough to suit me." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Kathy add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "I find television very educating. Every time somebody turns on the set, I go into the other room and read a book." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Kathy add a quote by S.E. Hinton
item.description: "Stay gold, Ponyboy, stay gold." -- S.E. Hinton

item.title: Kathy add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description: "I cannot live without books." -- Thomas Jefferson

item.title: Kathy add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Good books don't give up all their secrets at once." -- Stephen King

item.title: Kathy add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Kathy add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Good friends, good books, and a sleepy conscience: this is the ideal life." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Kathy add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "If one cannot enjoy reading a book over and over again, there is no use in reading it at all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Kathy add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "You don't have to burn books to destroy a culture. Just get people to stop reading them." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Kathy add a quote by Louisa May Alcott
item.description: "She is too fond of books, and it has turned her brain." -- Louisa May Alcott

item.title: Kathy add a quote by Walt Disney
item.description: "There is more treasure in books than in all the pirates' loot on Treasure Island and best of all, you can enjoy these riches every day of your life." -- Walt Disney

item.title: Kathy add a quote by Sir Francis Bacon
item.description: "Some books should be tasted, some devoured, but only a few should be chewed and digested thoroughly." -- Sir Francis Bacon

item.title: Kathy add a quote by Arnold Lobel
item.description: "Books to the ceiling, Books to the sky, My pile of books is a mile high. How I love them! How I need them! I'll have a long beard by the time I read them." -- Arnold Lobel

item.title: Kathy add a quote by Garrison Keillor
item.description: "A book is a gift you can open again and again." -- Garrison Keillor

item.title: Kathy add a quote by Jasper Fforde
item.description: "Take no heed of her.... She reads a lot of books." -- Jasper Fforde

item.title: Kathy add a quote by Desiderius Erasmus Roterodamus
item.description: "When I have a little money, I buy books; and if I have any left, I buy food and clothes." -- Desiderius Erasmus Roterodamus

item.title: Kathy add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "Do you know that books smell like nutmeg or some spice from a foreign land? I loved to smell them when I was a boy. Lord, there were a lot of lovely books once, before we let them go." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Kathy add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "If you have enough book space, I don't want to talk to you." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Kathy add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "If you don't have time to read, you don't have the time (or the tools) to write. Simple as that." -- Stephen King

item.title: Kathy add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Get busy living or get busy dying." -- Stephen King

item.title: Kathy add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Go then, there are other worlds than these." -- Stephen King

item.title: Kathy add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "If you want to be a writer, you must do two things above all others: read a lot and write a lot." -- Stephen King

item.title: Kathy add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Speaking personally, you can have my gun, but you'll take my book when you pry my cold, dead fingers off of the binding." -- Stephen King

item.title: Kathy add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Books are a uniquely portable magic." -- Stephen King

item.title: Kathy add a quote by Amos Bronson Alcott
item.description: "Stay is a charming word in a friend's vocabulary." -- Amos Bronson Alcott

item.title: Kathy add a quote by Amos Bronson Alcott
item.description: "Good books, like good friends, are few and chosen; the more select, the more enjoyable." -- Amos Bronson Alcott

item.title: Kathy add a quote by John Connolly
item.description: "For in every adult there dwells the child that was, and in every child there lies the adult that will be." -- John Connolly

item.title: Kathy add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "We are plain quiet folk, and I have no use for adventures. Nasty, disturbing, and uncomfortable things." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Kathy add a quote by Harper Lee
item.description: "Until I feared I would lose it, I never loved to read. One does not love breathing." -- Harper Lee

item.title: Kathy add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch
